attributes.action: Decriminalise abortion in Northern Ireland immediately.
attributes.additional_details:
"Today, in the United Kingdom, a woman has been found guilty of having an abortion. It’s a horrifying idea – one which should have been long relegated to the annals of history, but which is sadly still the reality for a woman living in Northern Ireland in 2016." - The Independent.

http://www.independent.co.uk/voices/today-in-the-uk-a-woman-was-sentenced-for-the-crime-of-having-an-abortion-yet-we-act-outraged-at-a6968356.html

This law must change. Abortion should be immediately decriminalised.
attributes.background: Last week, Donald Trump remarked that women who have abortions should be punished somehow. Rightly, this was met with a widely publicised outcry of condemnation. Yet in Northern Ireland, women are punished for having abortions, because it is a criminal offence. This must change. Now.

rejection.details:
Your petition is about something that the Northern Ireland Assembly is responsible for. The UK Parliament is unable to legislate on matters which are devolved to Northern Ireland.

If you live in Northern Ireland and would like to send your petition to the Northern Ireland Assembly, you can find the contact details here:

http://www.niassembly.gov.uk/about-the-assembly/contact-us/

Alternatively, you might be interested in signing the following petition: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/126665
